comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Seems to have been taken with this shot, elsewhere in the bain collection and apparently not up yet on Flickr: lcweb2.loc.gov/service/pnp/ggbain/04600/04614v.jpg Written on both negatives is an inscription "Park Row", then possibly "near Pearl Street", Park Row is a bit south of Chinatown. Unlike the other Chinatown shots, this has no Chinese businesses or people who look particularly Chinese. I can't find a match for the printing company, but Nadel & Shimmel toy company is listed in the Polk City Directory for 1919 at 132 Park Row. They might have moved or occupied more than one building on the block. play.google.com/books/reader?id=EJw0AQAAMAAJ&printsec... I think this block of Park Row buildings was demolished to make way for the new approaches to the Brooklyn Bridge in the mid-1950's. So it's not clear to me why this photo is in the Bain news stream. Perhaps it is related to the shooting referenced in a nearby Chinatown photo, but I cannot come up with a match.
